title: Checkpoint: Boot Camp Diagnostic
description: Diagnostic assessment to identify skill gaps from 6th grade. Covers integer operations, fraction/decimal fluency, simplifying expressions, solving basic equations, and coordinate plane basics.

remediationStrategy.description: Students scoring below threshold receive focused reteaching on their weakest skill areas before moving to Unit 1. Boot camp gaps will cascade into every subsequent unit if not addressed.

clusters.reteachFocus: Adding and subtracting integers using the number line; sign rules for multiplication and division (same signs produce positive, different signs produce negative); applying order of operations when negatives are present

Finding the LCD for adding and subtracting fractions with unlike denominators; multiplying fractions straight across and simplifying; dividing fractions by multiplying by the reciprocal; converting between fractions and decimals

Identifying like terms by matching variable parts; combining like terms by adding or subtracting their coefficients; applying the distributive property a(b + c) = ab + ac; multi-step simplification combining distribution and collecting like terms

Using inverse operations to isolate the variable; two-step strategy: undo addition or subtraction first, then undo multiplication or division; checking solutions by substituting back into the original equation

Identifying the four quadrants and their sign patterns (QI: +,+ QII: −,+ QIII: −,− QIV: +,−); plotting ordered pairs with x horizontal and y vertical; understanding reflections across axes and how they change coordinate signs

assessmentProblems.question: Evaluate: −4 + 9
assessmentProblems.answer: −4 + 9 = 5. Start at −4 on the number line and move 9 units to the right.

assessmentProblems.question: Evaluate: (−8) + 5 × (−2)
assessmentProblems.answer: Multiply first (order of operations): 5 × (−2) = −10. Then add: (−8) + (−10) = −18.

assessmentProblems.question: Evaluate: (3/4) ÷ (1/2)
assessmentProblems.answer: Divide by multiplying by the reciprocal: (3/4) × (2/1) = 6/4 = 3/2.

assessmentProblems.question: In which quadrant is the point (3, −2)?
assessmentProblems.answer: x is positive and y is negative, so the point is in Quadrant IV.

assessmentProblems.question: Name the quadrant for each point: A(−4, 5), B(2, −3), C(−1, −6)
assessmentProblems.answer: A(−4, 5): x negative, y positive → Quadrant II. B(2, −3): x positive, y negative → Quadrant IV. C(−1, −6): both negative → Quadrant III.

assessmentProblems.question: Point P is located at (3, −4). If P is reflected across the x-axis, what are the coordinates of the new point?
assessmentProblems.answer: Reflecting across the x-axis keeps x the same and flips the sign of y. New point: (3, 4).

answerKeys.bc-14: A: QII, B: QIV, C: QIII
